reviews.text: A classic lunch counter in the heart of DC! Right across the street from the U street metro station on the yellow/green line. Fast, friendly service. Counter order and then seat yourself. The meal combo deal is an extra $5 for a fountain drink and fries. I recommend skipping it because it's not quite worth it. Spend the money on a milkshake instead! The walls are filled with pictures famous people who have eaten there. This place is great! Definitely check it out.

Walk in and order, they will bring you your food.  There are a few tables up front, in the middle and in the back.  Pictures of famous people all over the walls.  Even have a TV playing with more pictures.  This is a DC landmark.

The place is fun to check out.  But the chili was just ok...

Service was good.

This is one of the best hot dogs I have ever had. I ended up getting 2 of them. They are on the pricier side, but they are worth it. They come with chili of you choose to get that as a topping. The hot dogs that ended up getting were all beef. One set of fries is all you need. There's also a place right next door that they own that has some really good cheap drinks. Great spot.

I was told that a visit to DC is MUST include the Original Ben's Chili Bowl on U street in the Shaw neighborhood of DC.

What I learned is that Ben’s is not just a minority owned restaurant, it is a civil rights landmark. Stepping into Ben’s is looking back at a glimpse of history and feeling the sense of community it built.

Like a museum, Ben’s walls are adorned with framed photographs, of founders, Virginia and her late husband, Ben, taken throughout the past 60 years; or photographs of famous visitors. You can even sit at the table Barack Obama sat!

The staff were welcoming, patient and personable. I’m not a big chili or hot dog eater but they took the time to explain the menu to me and recommended items, even though it was very busy.

They also have vegan and gluten free options.

The place is not small, but, it will fill a bit like that at Fridays and Saturdays night as in the middle of the bar and club zone, along with its tourist popularity because Obama was there (along with some other celebrities).

They say they have parking at the back, I did not do much to find it as I already have parked my car somewhere else.

The food is very good if not great, it feels of good quality and fresh, with obviously a great and original flavour. Even though, the price is low, I would say the portions are small too, so consider this when ordering so you take two hamburger instead of one!!!

The people working in there is friendly, however, it looks they are overworked and not organized, making the service to be slow and giving a somewhat bad experience because they tend to forget orders (they forgot mine twice).

Overall good place to have dinner after a long day of walking and visiting museums or to have something in your stomach just before starting the party or after it.

This is a fantastic restaurant in the D.C. area. Myself and some friends had brunch reservations at 9:00 and had a fabulous time. The server was knowledgeable, professional, and funny, and our food was fantastic!

They also had fresh bread as a little appetizer from a local bakery included in the meal. There was hand churned butter to put on the bread as well.

The only negative thing that I have to say about this restaurant is the mosquitoes and flying insects. The windows were wide open, and with that, bugs flew around our food occasionally. It was extremely annoying. This is the only reason I’m giving this place four stars and not five.

Overall, my party enjoyed themselves, and the Quiche Florentine, salad, and fresh bread were excellent. Everyone enjoyed their meals, and the atmosphere was calm and fitting for the restaurant.

I’m not sure if I will be back or would recommend this place because of the open windows and flying bugs, but I did enjoy myself other than that.

Note: Don’t get the side of bacon - it isn’t worth the price.

Very cool restaurant, everything is very, very tasty, and looks great. We were satisfied with everything, I definitely recommend visiting this place in Washington.

Here I tried one of the tastiest onion soups I've ever had.  Escargots were also delicious, and garlic oil, in which they were baked, tasted very good with their home bread with nuts and cranberries. And the duck was also very tasty, order especially this dish. We ate it very quickly. The meat was well fried, the sauce went well, and the sweet plum complemented the taste. We also decided to try a dessert , and we selected profiteroles. Beautiful presentation, they were poured with chocolate, and it also tasted very well.

My Last meal in DC, Le Diplomate was a Perfect way to end an amazing trip. Star of the show was Millie our server!
Her attention to detail, and anticipation of our needs was impeccable. Highly suggest you request her for optimal dining experience.
The food came out at a beautiful pace and exploded with flavor and love. I highly recommend this place. Pace out your small plates share your entrees and enjoy the beautiful ambience! Merci. See you soon DC!

There are so many great brunch spots in DC, but this place tops them all. Better make that reservation since this place is always packed. From complementary bread basket to a variety of desserts, I never had any bad moments in this restaurant. My favorite dishes are egg Benedict, mushroom tart, escargot, and quiche. Service is also outstanding and everyone is so friendly. There aren’t a lot of parking spaces nearby though. I highly recommend this restaurant for brunch or celebrating any special days.

Amazing place! The food is so delicious, the wait time is short! I always eat different fish over there, those are always wonderful! The dessert presentations are so fancy! I tried onion soup as well, it was good! The waiters are so polite! Always crowded but very organized place! Love it!

Made a thirty min trip to try this location and it was def worth it. The waitress, Phoenix, was phenomenal! We also loved all of our food. The Mediterranean burger with lamb was such great combination of flavors. We shared the pancakes and French toast because our six year old couldn’t finish it. We had plenty of leftovers. My husband ordered the egg and cheddar burger and said it was pretty good. I loved the art and the vibe of the place. We arrived around 1030 and there was barely anyone there on Sunday. But literally when we left at 1120, the entire building seemed packed to capacity. Glad we came early for brunch! Well, three locations down and plenty more to try. This chain has a reputation of having great quality food, drinks, art, books and id family friendly. But could be great for a group of friends or lover.

A great birthday dinner! The food was good and well suited for lots of different dietary preferences. It was busy, so service was a little slow, but very friendly! Only real complaint is the drinks — although cheaper than most DC cocktails they were also a little underwhelming.

My food and drink were delicious!!! The service, however, was pretty good...once I was actually severed. LOL I waited a long time after being seated. A couple seated after me was served before me. My server had to be told to come to my table and she barely checked on me. She apologized so it made me feel a little better, but I'm definitely expecting stellar service my next visit. Also, they have a nice bookstore! I forgot to take a picture of the carrot cake I took to go. It was so good!

I loved the food here so much, I came back the next day at a different  location. They didn't disappoint, but I wasn't able to get the vegan lovers pasta that made me want to come back just because it's only available after 3pm
I ended up getting a black bean burger, and another pomegranate lemonade with fries. This was good too but that pasta will be what brings me back a third time for sure. My daughter felt the same way about the vegan cheesecake. She bought one to go just because it was so delicious.
I definitely recommend all vegans and non-vegans eat here. They really had something for everyone.

When you visit places like this , it feels wrong that you can give it only 5 stars. I would give this place an entire constellation for the amazing atmosphere , great food, a mix of people enjoying the moment. The combination with food, drinks, art, photos and books makes this place a heaven on earth. Great service. If poetry had a place this would be the right one. If you live in Dc or you simply are visiting make this place a priority for your meals or just for a drink with your friends. Great job guys for this extraordinary concept

Great craft beer bar, knowledgeable bar staff, 50 beers on tap, wish they had less national/big craft beers on tap and more local.  Extensive beer bottle list with hard to find beers, especially good Belgium beer selection.  Fast friendly service, hard to notice from the street.  Definitely recommend a visit if you love beer.

Do you like good craft beer? Well if you’re in DC’s Logan Circle neighborhood you definitely need to check this place out. It has a massive beer selection with something for every taste. From awesome DIPA and everything in between. Also we had the tater tots and the cauliflower bites… and they were incredibly delicious. Also, a super cool vibe inside with plenty of seating. A must see if you enjoy great beer.

Top notch selection of craft beers in DC. Also one of the most extensive whiskey/ bourbon catalogs around. Atmosphere is good, and the food comes through.  The homemade tots are a must have. Great location on 14th st close to Logan circle. Stop and have a beer or two.

Walking up to the chalkboard signage propped directly infront of this black and brick fortress, I was prepared to be greeted by your run of the mill, New-American watering hole. What I came to find once I walked up those hallowed steps was a dimly lit leather sanctuary that would quickly become one of my favorite beer and bourbon bars I've ever had the pleasure of visiting.

The ambiance alone is enough to keep you coming back - you can tell they put a lot of effort into finding just the right lighting with just the right accents to fine tune your brain for booze consumption. Let me stop dancing around the main point here - ChurchKey's beer list rivals the best I've ever seen. This may sound hyperbolic, and maybe it is, but having been exposed to world class beer bars across the States I feel my barometer is calibrated to appreciate what this place is trying to accomplish. Anytime you have fresh IPAs from Fidens/Monkish/Other Half in the same vicinity as Side Project white labels and rare Cantillon lambics, you know you've fallen into a honey hole.

The bourbon list, though not as extensive as their beer offerings, is perfectly curated with many top tier choices. Anywhere from a Weller Antique 107 to a Michter's 20 - they truly have an incredible lineup of brown water.

I can't really comment on the food as my trip was all business (alcohol only), but from what I could tell they're no slouches on the grub they serve up here.

If you are a lover of beer or bourbon or even just want a nice pint of your go-to sauce, you need to go to Church.
Insane craft beer menu! This place is the bomb - incredible menu of beers on tap and in the fridge. Awesome ambiance. We’ll just have to keep coming back to get through the menu 🍻

Worst place ever. The portions are the size of a side order but the price is that of a sitdown restaurant. Food is extremely greesy and oily. You will tatse a little bit of spice with oil in the whole dish and you end up eating that with whole lot of rice (see the pics) seriously save your money and go somehwere else. Not worth your money at all.

It used to be really good (about 3 yrs ago). Not sure why the quality and quantity started going down. However, it is one of the very few places where I would order a biryani from (In DC). Other places do NOT match up to the flavor that Red Toque offers. That being said, I sincerely hope they would go back to what they were doing back in 2016. It was really good!

I am glad that I did not read the reviews before I get there, because I really like it and definitely will order again. And the personal were really nice. By the way, for me the plates are good enough I order for me and my husband and we ate and still have food for lunch de next day 😁.
Thank you 🙏🏽

Delicious, authentic, hearty food! I can't get enough of the tabbouleh, chicken kabob and daal. This place is perfect for dining in with friends (or a date!) or for delivery. You don't even have to feel bad about it because the food is healthy and often vegetarian! I would definitely recommend it, especially to shake things up from usual American restaurants.

That's a lot of rice, throw a little lettuce in there to balance it out!
It's okay. Spices are okay not super impressed but it eats well. I'm used to getting a small 1/4 to 1/2 cup sized salad in these kinds of dishes but this one was all rice, some meat, some chickpeas. I get that you need to preserve profit in this covid life we're living but let's be reasonable here. I ordered kabob with rice not rice with kabob.

Absolutely amazing! The muscles were just so good, we had to get more bread so we could sop up the sauce. The blackened catfish and shrimp and grits were perfect and delicious. They also gave us a little basket of the the most delicious bread and corn bread muffins in the world! But definitely, the best thing we ate was the bananas foster!! SOOOO GOOD!

One small complaint, is that the lobster Rangoon did not seem worth the price. They were pretty good, but you only get 3 for $19. I wouldn’t recommend getting those.

This place is one of my favorites! Where do I start? The vibe and atmosphere is fun, the service was amazing, and the food was 10/10

I definitely suggest oysters…of course! But the brunch menu is incredible as well. I went twice in one weekend.

Will absolutely be back!

We were in town for a wedding and read the Google reviews. We saw that the food was stellar and we saw Quincy was the waiter to have. Reserved on Open Table and Tammy was SO nice at the desk. She seated us right away. Quincy is probably really great BUT we had Tim as our server. He was AWESOME! The food was SPECTACULAR. We have eaten in New Orleans often and this was right up there with Acme!! Thank you to Tim, Tammy AND the Chef! Great experience….. we WILL be back!

After a week of sightseeing in DC with my mom and my girlfriend and many great meals we wanted to finish on a high note but still casual. We could not chosen better with PDOP. Service was lovely, food very tasty and fresh and reasonable price wise for the area and compared to other restaurants in DC. Really loved it and would recommend to anyone for their last night or any celebration. Drinks were super tasty too. Loved it!!

Pretty disappointed by the oysters. We got a dozen mixed oysters and some were barely oysters (so tiny) while one was the size of two oysters you had to cut it in half. Shucking wasn’t so great and there was no brine (no saltiness at all) in 4 of them, as if they had been washed out in freshwater. Martini was good but inconsistent in taste.

My brothers and I had dinner here tonight! Absolutely delicious, we sat outside by the fireplace.
The music, energy and the food was incredible!!!
10/10
our waiter suggested we get 6-8 plates and we
did just that,his recommendations and reassurance of our selections was greatly appreciated. Highly recommend you try the items pictured. Won’t be disappointed, I really appreciate the delivery, and execution of this meal. You elevated and made our night. Thank you. There is nothing better than a shared meal with the ones you love.

Barcelona is another DC classic for good reason. The only downside to it is that it’s constantly packed, you often have to wait for a table, and it’s quite noisy inside. However, once you’re seated, service is surprisingly fast and attentive considering how busy the restaurant is. They’re a great wine bar — huge wine list, many very reasonably priced and still quite good bottles which is always appreciated. All the tapas are delicious, I’ve never ordered anything here that I haven’t enjoyed. Very very fun place to go with friends for a boozy, tasty meal so long as you don’t mind the crowds & noise, and maybe having to wait a bit for a table.

Wonderful tapas, but at the price you should be picky on what you buy into.

The recommended board is a great starting point, but the potatoes bravos are really the only thing you need off it.

The meatballs were prepared in a fantastic spicy tomato sauce. Plus the portion was good for the price compared to most items.

While the flan tasted great, it felt like the sugar on the top was burnt a bit. Whether purposeful or not it was a great combination

The steak was wonderful, but the portion was terrible for the price

We got the white sangria pitcher, I would recommend the red. The white came off a bit bitter

The food was worth the price, but spend wisely

The food is great - the bread is so good that we need to try really hard to stop ourselves finishing it; the bacon wrapped dates is amazing, the balance between savory & sweetness is very impressive; potato bravos is potato bravos, very yummy; also love their cauliflower with vinaigrette, a very refreshing taste to balance out the heaviness from potato bravos.

One thing to note is that the music was pretty loud. It did give a great ambiance (we almost want to go out party after the meal!), but also makes it a bit hard to have conversation as you kind of need to yell.

This food was SO good and the bread is house made fresh and complimentary! 😉 so you know we got LOTS of bread. Also, the price wasn’t too bad for dine in! The wine was also really good. And such an amazing vibe inside and outside. Overall loved it!

I am surprised this restaurant does not more reviews. I just had dinner there, compliments to the chef. Pumpkin curry was phenomenal, flavorful and filling. My husband had the pork curry, I didn’t have a taste but he finished it quickly. A complement I’m sure. We finished our meal with the sticky rice and mango, it’s a great way to treat ourselves. While the service was a little bit slow, it’s because there is only one person cooking. That was understandable, we still highly recommend it and it is worth coming to visit. Come in a chill vibe.

I love love this restaurant!!!! ✨❤️ Legit Thai food!!! The owner is the one personally cooking the food. He is from Thailand so the dishes are delicious. On Thursday night they had a 6 course set meal. With each meal brought to is we had a surprise! From crunchy egg rolls to coconut soup, spicy papaya salad! The ending was exactly what we needed: sticky sweet rice with sweet mango!! We will come back just to eat here!!

This place was fantastic. A set menu dinner in Washington, DC for only $30 per person. A total of 8 dishes including a tom yum soup, chicken satay, papaya salad, pumpkin curry, salmon curry, black fungus with ginger, a smoky noodle dish and finally coconut rice with mango.

Everything was beautifully presented with lovely balanced flavours.

If you like Thai cuisine this is a must try.
I will eat here every week until I move away. Brilliant Southern Thai restaurant in an extremely unique row home setting. Blown away. Pre fixe menu samples everything. I love it. Eat here.

Thai X-ing was absolutely amazing!
The ambience was very romantic with a lovely second floor view next to a window, as me and my wife went there and enjoyed a dinner for two.

The four couse meal was scrumptious!
The service was a warm, humble and attentive!!
I strongly urge everyone whether you are living in DC proper or just visiting to try it!!
WORTH EVERY PENNY!!!
20 STARS FOR THEM!!!

So glad I stumbled upon this little gem of a place. Not fancy, serves beer in jars, and has some killer brisket and pulled pork. This is a great place for work happy hour. Super casual, good food, cool vibe.

Been coming here for almost a decade and couldn't be more glad to have this place in the neighborhood. Okay amount of seating both inside and out, decent staff who are pretty quick and attentive, and delicious swachos (including a vegetarian option). I dig the mason-jar-for-draft vibe too. Note for the sensitive: smoking is permitted on the front patio.

Cool venue and selection of beers but they add gratuity automatically to your check and don't tell you they've done that. When asking the bar tenders about that they pretty much made it clear they expect you to tip on top of the about with the gratuity automatically included.

American Ice was rightfully popular on Saturday night. They have plenty of indoor and outdoor seating options. The prices are reasonable and the drink service was prompt. As a wine enthusiast, I would have preferred to have more options to choose from. The industrial decor and open concept enhance the atmosphere and overall experience at the bar.
The vibe is cool, the service is really bad, the food is mid. It's pretty expensive for what you get, and it's got auto-gratitudy, which isn't very clearly said or labeled anywhere but the receipt

I came here for dinner on a Friday night and had a good experience! It wasn't too crowded and we were easily able to get a table for two. We got one of the combination platter (I think it was 27) and it was a good way to try a variety of the food and it was plenty for 2 people! They also have a good variety of drinks. Everything tasted pretty good, it's a good option if you're looking for Ethiopian food in the area.

Almost everything about the food is amazing, ranging from taste to portion to variety. My friend and I went to Shenandoah National Park during the day for some pretty intense hiking so we went into Dukem hungry for food. I had never been there prior to such, so I could not relate to anything mentioned in some other reviews in which people had mentioned how the portions had gotten smaller either due to inflation or change of management, but there was definitely enough food for the two of us. We got one of the combination platters, and some samosas. There was so much meat and veggies that we had to use extra injera for such. The only reason I am giving the place a 4 instead of a 5 star is due to the cleanliness. Some people mentioned flies, and I experienced such as well. Our table was also very sticky and required some additional cleaning prior to us being able to dine. When my friend and I went there, there was nobody else, maybe because it was early dinner time, so once again, I cannot relate too much with the service complaints. I have been to a couple of Ethiopian restaurants around the area, and I will recommend Dukem because it is one of those "hole in the wall" places where you can rely on for good food despite potential problems elsewhere. It doesn't look as fancy, but it has quite a bit of cultural presentation and representation, and that always matters more.

This place is a DC treasure! Located on U street in the unofficial little Ethiopia. I enjoyed the juicy lamb tibs with a small tomato salad. It’s was so flavorful! I hadn’t eaten here before though I had intended too several times. After hearing the owner passed away, it gave me more reason to enjoy a meal and pay my respects.

This Ethiopian restaurant was worth the travel from Miami. I tried the vegetarian combo platter, and it was absolutely sensational. I devoured the whole thing, and everything was delicious and spiced, perfectly portioned, and wonderfully presented. The staff is super friendly, and the food is outstanding. This is a family owned restaurant with lots of family values. You will not regret coming to this amazing spot.

I have been a loyal customer of Dukem for the last decade. Dukem was the first Ethiopian restaurant I visited when I lived to DC over a decade ago - and till date the only one I patronize. Friends, colleagues, visiting relatives - we bring everyone to Dukem.

For the first time - Service was atrocious! Beyond reprehensible. My brother and I walked in and the waitress ignored us for 10-15 minutes ( while all the Caucasian customers were served) until I requested a menu.

1 -We ordered a beer, a tea and a vegetarian platter. My brother got his beer but my tea never came - 15 minutes later ( and after asking 2x) - I was informed that they were out of tea. Would have been nice to know so that I could have ordered another beverage.

2- I asked for a side plate and some cutlery with my food. The waitress said she would bring it but didn’t - I asked again and then a third time. By this time we were 70% done with our food. The fourth time I walked up to the bar and asked again - she finally brought it out begrudgingly. All this while the other Caucasian tables around us were being served and asked if they needed anything / we were ignored.

3- finally after waiting for another 20 minutes, we paid the bill at the counter - only for the hostess who had been extremely rude until then to charge a mandatory 18% service charge . I’m not sure if this is a rule but their service did not warrant 18% and it was not communicated ahead of time. At this time we didn’t want to waste any more time there and we left ( with a very bitter taste from the whole situation)

It’s a shame - because the food was exceptional as always . I never experienced such blatant disregard and such terrible racial profiling at an establishment. It’s a shame it was at DUKEM

Cool stop off spot for lunch today. Bartender Brandon was phenom and had a tasty burger Truffle Mushroomed up. Hip interior and cozy atmosphere. Will def be back for karaoke, trivia, and fun weekends! They have deals each day as well to check out.

Me and 3 of my friends came here for the first time and loved it!
I love that they have a digital jukebox where you can pick songs to play! We were treated to an impromptu karaoke session by guests at another table but it was in fun so it didn't disturb our time!
The drinks were tasty, potent and not expensive! Which makes me happy!
I ordered the fried chicken, which was delicious and crunchy like I prefer, the sides were good too! My friends ordered steak, which I sampled and it was tasty as well!
Overall, I would recommend this place and definitely will return!

Good place to watch a World Cup game.
We were in town and looking for a place for my son to watch the Argentina game (by the way, it was a great game going into a OT and then a kick-off).  My son had the grilled chicken wings, which were good and crispy.   I had the country fried steak, which was cooked well.  The only thing I could say about the meal was the biscuit was a bit dry, and what I mean is that when you broke it in half, it crumbled like a cracker, it was ok because I got  my eggs cooked over medium so I just scooped it up with the egg yolk.  We also had the chicken and waffles.  The meals were good we just wish they had come out a little hotter.

The service we had was really good, I didn't get the man's name, but he was on point with our drinks and food and always asking if we needed anything.

Menus are viewed via app, and payment for meals is via app as well.

We tried Shaw Tavern on a very cold and snowy Sunday afternoon. Despite the snow, the restaurant was still busy and there was a 30-40 minute wait. Once we finally got seated, the service was pretty quick. Water came immediately, followed by mimosas which were good. For entrees we had the shrimp and grits, the ham and cheese omelette (substitute sausage for the ham) and the vegetable omelet with potatoes. The potatoes were the most flavorful part of the meal! The other things were mediocre, but still hit the spot.

Omg YUM. We came for dinner and my husband got the jambalaya and I got the braised short rib mac and cheese. The mac and cheese was AMAZING... like a real symphony of surprising and delicious flavors. My husband said the jambalaya was very good also. We will definitely be back!

Amazing service, great ambiance and delicious food. The portions are small/personal for the price but delicious nonetheless. Had a few amazing vegetarian options and the waiter was kind enough to explain everything to us.

Came here for my boyfriend’s birthday and had an amazing experience. Guillermo was our server and he went above and beyond with not only us, but all of his tables to ensure everyone had a great time and was very informed about the menu items. Complimentary champagne and dessert was brought out to us, and it could not have been a better experience. Definitely worth the money spent, everything we tasted was absolutely amazing. So glad I chose this place for his birthday!

The thing that I love about the Red hen is that the menu is constantly adjusting to accommodate fresh, in season ingredients. The experience never gets old and the food is reliably delicious. It’s easiest if you have a reservation, but you can sometimes sneak in at the bar. Highest recommendation! Worth every penny, every time.

Great food, great ambiance, and great service. The food is elegantly presented and absolutely cooked to perfection. You'll struggle for a reservation during busy periods, but that's the same with all good restaurants; if you can't get a reservation, grab a seat at the bar.

All natural wines by the glass paired with amazing food and a large, airy bar in a rustic setting. Very friendly bartenders too. The whipped ricotta crostini was one of the best things I’ve ever had, and yes you can order Cacio e Pepe off the menu and it’s delicious. A lovely gem!

I almost did not want to post a review for this place because I do not want to share it! From the servers, to the food, to the drinks, everything was so phenomenal! My friend goes very often and asked a few of us to join for her birthday, it’s officially one of my new favorite restaurants. I arrived after happy hour was ending but our server still gave me happy hour prices, and gave me suggestions on what to eat. We basically ordered everything on the menu (pad Thai, beef strips, fish, Brussels sprouts). Will definitely be back!

I definitely would recommend this restaurant on any day! The ambiance is superb! The food is outstanding! Fantastic alcoholic options… including endless mimosas. I also ended up ordering their iced Vietnamese Coffee to go for the perfect pick me up!

I really enjoyed my experience here. Had the spring rolls as the first appetizer and they had a great crunch and the contents were tasty, even though I prefer a sweeter dipping sauce. The crispy chicken wings were fried so well, no complaints. The beef in the beef platter was so juicy, the sauce on top was flavorful and it had a chewier consistency. Person I was with loved the stir fried rice noodle as well. The $7 dragonfruit daiquiri was good as well. Would def come back

Yesterday my boyfriend and I went here and everything was great. For drinks we ordered the electric kiss, a little too sweet but tasty. For apps we ordered the pork steamed dumplings and fried beef jerky. 10/10. For entrees we ordered Seafood curry and Shaken Beef. Seafood curry was to die for and wasn’t not coconut based which made it better because I am not a fan of coconut curry or coconut anything. I definitely recommend this place.

Passing by this restaurant, we looked at the plates and decided to take a table. We liked the service, the food and the atmosphere. Our server Mike was super attentive and fast. The weather was kind of gloomy and he drew our attention, that it might rain ))) We felt welcome in this place. The food was amazing as well. We ordered beef with sticky rice, stir fried noodles and crunchy wings as an appetizer. Dish sizes are generous and yummy!

We held a wonderful surprise dinner last Friday.  The food was delicious and prepared nicely, compliments to the chef! The ambiance of the restaurant was perfect for our birthday celebration and the staff was phenomenal, especially Natasha!!! Everything was amazing!
Thanks to Corduroy for making Friday a special night.

We hosted a dinner in the private room upstairs with 17 guests for a wedding celebration and had a phenomenal experience. Our bartender took great care of us and was very accommodating. The service through dinner was terrific and the food was to die for.

We set up a pre fixe menu for our guests and selected some wines to serve during dinner. The process of selecting our menu in preparation was terrific. We also had some food allergies in our patty, and the staff was very helpful in navigating that.

We had a great experience and highly recommend the private rooms if you have a larger party!

Excellent tasting menu !

My family and I visited this establishment for my husband's birthday dinner. We had all different food restrictions (allergies, food preferences) and the chef accommodated all of our request for all of our tasting courses ! Foods were excellent. Service was out standing. Price was reasonable !

Can't wait to go back !

Definitely an interesting menu, however the tasting was enjoyable. Expect smaller portions and more light fare than dinner. The ambiance is what makes the restaurant, dark and moody, with an excellent wine selection. The hostess was also a great support to us throughout our tasting course. I may not return but I'm glad I got to experience it.

Came here for a company dinner. Accommodated me as a vegan 🌱, ended up having all courses available and they tasted amazing.

Colleagues all loved their food as well.

Server was great - really nice guy, had a few jokes and some banter as well.

A reliable DC rooftop. I’ve been here many many times, sometimes it’s beyond crowded, where it’s uncomfortable and sweaty, and sometimes the mosquitoes can get you up here. But overall a good place to have in the rotation. I was just recently here on a Sunday, ordered a few hookahs, vodka soda $16 here, and they do add a 20% service fee already so that includes the tip. $16 is a lot to me for a very basic drink, but that’s how it goes. The bathroom line is never too bad, and they have a water jug at the bar on all this is a good spot.
Food was good and came out fast, service was ok, drinks eh not that great. You order and pay with your phone btw. Rooftop was too crowded so didn't get to experience it that night

I liked dining here for HH. The jerk chicken tacos and mojitos were good. The waiters are very attentive. While the menu is limited I think it creates better quality small bites. I really liked the buttermilk chicken sandwich, truffle fries and the Ceasar brussel sprouts.

Went for Sunday brunch.  I've never experienced a place where you ordered everything through an app, with limited wait staff engagement. However, our server was very nice and accommodating. They played good music, and served delicious bottomless mimosas.  Seating was kind of close to other guests, whereas there was no privacy; we could hear the guests during next to us whole conversation. Overall the food & vibes were good.

Good Location right on U .. and I like that it’s a rooftop, hip hop music was ok but djs always play the same thing need someone versatility.. PAID 25 dollars per drink then 20% service fee is insane for a small cup !! How high do they think they can keep raising their drink prices.. 2 drinks came to 60 dollars after the fee and tax not worth it very weak and small

Bar Pilar is a narrow bar with an upstairs dining room. We ate downstairs in the bar. It's a bar, so was a little noisy, but were still able to have a nice conversation. Service was excellent. The food was fantastic, both in presentation and how it tasted. We had the roasted vegetables, butter chicken and a dumpling appetizer - all wonderful. The cocktails were tasty and had enough alcohol in them to justify the price. I don't think you can go wrong eating here unless you are looking for someplace really quiet. I never went upstairs.

The WORST experience. Upstairs bar was rude. Barely anyone in his section. Got my order wrong after we waited forever. Then waited again for my shrimp. Told us he would switch to hiphop when all the “white” ppl leave. I actually enjoyed the music. Won’t be returning. I really didn’t even want to tip bc woah. Nice cup though.

We returned to Bar Pilar this Sunday for brunch.  First time since the pandemic.  Excellent food, tasty drinks, outstanding service, fun playlist, and both family and party friendly.  We were a table of seven including two kids and had a GREAT time.  We will definitely be back.

Absolutely loved the customer service here. Everyone was friendly, attentive, and welcoming. It was my first time here, so I wasn't sure what to expect. The food is like an Asian and Latin fusion (shrimp tempura tacos, guac burger, or zucchini fritters with sambal sauce). Normally, I'm not a huge fan of fusion cuisine but they married the 2 cuisines perfectly here. I had the braised pork steam buns (2 per order) and the shrimp tacos (3 per order) -- Both were delicious. I especially enjoyed the shrimp tacos as they were light, but packed with flavor!!! The cocktails were also great. Would definitely love to go back and try some more, even though it's a far drive from where I live. Would absolutely recommend!! 💯

We came here after being added to the Ted’s Bulletin 1hr and 45 minute wait list. If people knew how awesome the food is here, I’m guessing they wouldn’t willingly wait in that line. We ordered the pork hash and the barbecue chicken pancakes entree and the food was simply heavenly. Our server, Lissa, was wonderful too. Bloody Mary was nice and spicy. So glad we came here!

Some additional comments about the pancakes. Usually, I have to butter my pancakes and add syrup before I can dive in. This place not only butters and syrups the pancakes but as you can see, they stage the pancake with the pork belly bacon and fried chicken on top. Wish I could give 6 stars.

Brunch was absolutely amazing, and the patio seating was gorgeous! All of the servers were incredibly friendly and helpful. I also absolutely love that gluten free options not only exist, but also are clearly labeled. The gluten free brownie sundae was especially amazing - the texture and flavor were spot on. Pricing is also excellent - it was much cheaper than I expected, especially in regards to the quality/quantity of food and the fact that it's in DC. 10/10, would recommend!

Yummy brunch spot with a great outdoor dining set up- it was spacious and had heating lamps. Service was amazing and food was bomb. FYI, the portions are big and certainly shareable (especially the breakfast pizza!) we weren't able to finish it all!

Me and a friend dined in for breakfast this past Saturday. I ordered the breakfast tacos w/potatoes. The friend ordered steak, eggs & pancakes. We topped off our meals with bottomless mimosas.  Everything was divine. Kyle was our server.  I would definitely recommend this place.

My Manager set up a Holiday team gathering for a mixology class here. We started out w a rose and made 3 drinks w tastings in between. It was very informational and the timing between cocktails were spot on. The instructor was fantastic and very generous on the liquor. I personally wasn’t a fan on the drink with Chartreuse but the history she told us, behind the liquor was fun/interesting to learn. The food in between were delicious that we stayed for full plates of food after. Service was spot on and food were great.
Very relaxing atmosphere with open minded people. Great spot for breakfast!  Staff were a little busy because it was a packed house but did their best to serve us in a timely manner. Would recommend!

A thorough menu of food and drink options in a variety of different spaces to kick back with a beverage. A cool, large bar/restaurant.

Brunch consists of a varying plates, including hot chicken and some meatless/vegetarian dishes. All we're delicious.

A cinnamon roll or two for the table makes a great starter.

Star deduction: You'll find an automatic 20% gratuity regardless of party size.

Excellent spot in the heart of Bloomingdale. New American style pub offerings with solid cocktails and exceptionally warm service.

We went for brunch and had a really great experience from start to finish. Their house Bloody Mary is the best so far I've had in DC, a robust one with just enough heat to make it interesting.

We tried the deviled eggs and they were pretty good. The eggs themselves were a bit ordinary but the jalapeno crisps were a nice touch that tipped things over to good.

My main was the sausage Benedict with their homemade sausage and it was solid, definitely worth trying. The accompanying potatoes were not memorable.

Everything else we tried including their cinnamon roll was very good.

Looking forward to returning to try more of the menu.

The best customer service experience since Covid started! I got the Honey Hot Chicken for my entrée, which was amazing. As for my drink, I’m pretty specific as to what I like. I asked for the sweetest drink on the menu and my waitress debated with the bartender to create the best drink that fitted me perfectly. Highly recommend this spot!!

A decent restaurant bar. We arrived for brunch and their were ample seating. The mimosas came in a regular glass cup. The taste might have been better if it were served in a traditional flute. Had the deviled eggs which were good, but nothing to rave about. The hot honey chicky benny was delectable!

This pub had a nice atmosphere and the staff was very friendly. We tried the Irish Coffee, which was not to our liking. The hot chicken sandwich was good. Overall, the bar had a welcoming vibe but the food and drinks we tried weren’t to our liking. Would come here again.

The best vibe and my favorite restaurant in DC. Brought my family here for my 21st birthday and they had a great time. Happy Hour is well priced and the staff is incredibly helpful and friendly. I look forward to coming back with everyone who comes to visit me in DC or just for a good time out. Highly recommend!

Came for a late night drink and wasn't denied. Not only that, felt at home and the service was fair. Great, but when I say fair, I was treated like a patron and not a dollar. Thanks to Pablo for serving a great drink and I told him to give me what he thought was the best margarita in the house... had the nerve to serve me freaking Topaz!!! But it was AWESOME! THANKS FOR A GREAT EXPERIENCE 🙂

LOVED IT HERE. The vibes are immaculate it's a very fun atmosphere and the kitchen is open late. The service is extremely quick, the drinks are great, and the prices are good. I had the Miami Vice Daquiri and it was as thick as a smoothie. The enchiladas were also delicious and comes with guac! Highly recommend.

The food came out very quickly, but once the restaurant  got busier we saw our server less and less. It took about 30mins to get someone to bring our check to the table. The food was decent at best and the drinks we okay. Overall It's a good inexpensive place for a quick happy hour.

Dope spot to have some frozen margaritas and tasty Mexican food. Right on the popular U street in DC, where you can find the next spot after eating. The prices are pretty good, you won’t feel like you broke the bank. The staff and bartenders were friendly and attentive.

We stopped by @cafesaintex for dinner and a few drinks with the ladies. What a time! Great music, good vibes, and shout out to our friends the security guards.

- Chinito's Wings w/ truffle fries
- Jerked Chicken Wings w/ Mac n' Cheese
- Veggie burger w/ truffle fries

Follow us on IG to see more food pics: @BrwndButter

Exterior cafe order window... Side patio section... interior bar and limited seating... and basement level dance floor with DJ & bar.
Aside from folks attempting to loiter in my face to get in front of the °rotating ceiling° fan, and trying to sit on the table that was in front of me, a good time.
This place is cute, drinks were eh, food was good, service was great. Our server Cynthia was awesome and fast, I think she was the only server last night and we never had any issues

I heard many good things about this place and wanted to try it out for my birthday. When we arrived, there was confusion about my reservation even though I made it in advance, and it was hard to contact staff to create one. Most of my party didn’t like their meal, and the dance floor wasn’t open by the time we were finished. Also, they don’t have enough bathrooms and do not have great seating for large parties. Maybe a decent place for a quick drink and then bounce.

The comedy show was great. Not everyone was funny but the ones that were made the experience ok. The show took place in the basement which was smaller than I imagined but the settings was nice. The bartender was friendly but he could've made my drink a little stronger for $17.00.
